name: Vatsal Jain
about:
IIT Delhi's Electrical and Electronics Engineering program has equipped me with a solid foundation in problem-solving, teamwork, and technical excellence. During my Software Engineer Internship at Atlassian, I contributed to enhancing their data orchestration platform by enabling critical features, improving agility, and ensuring data lineage preservation, leveraging tools like Python, Airflow, and DBT.

As Technical Secretary, I spearheaded the first-ever Tech General Championship, driving innovation and collaboration. I also developed and maintained the TRYST website using React.js and Django, ensuring real-time updates for IIT Delhi’s annual tech fest. Focused on impactful projects, I aim to apply my technical expertise to solve complex challenges and foster growth in dynamic environments.

experiences.description:
Enhanced Atlassian's data orchestration platform by enabling flow descriptor renaming, improving agility and maintainability for 100+ teams. I ensured seamless environment updates and developed validation logic to preserve data lineage, saving hours of manual work. Additionally, built a solution for sending custom metrics from Python DBT jobs to SignalFX, enhancing real-time observability. My expertise spans Python, Airflow, DBT, Databricks, and more, backed by comprehensive documentation efforts for user adoption and operational excellence.
Enhanced Atlassian's data orchestration platform by enabling flow descriptor renaming, improving agility and maintainability for 100+ teams. I ensured seamless environment updates and developed validation logic to preserve data lineage, saving hours of manual work. Additionally, built a solution for sending custom metrics from Python DBT jobs to SignalFX, enhancing real-time observability. My expertise spans Python, Airflow, DBT, Databricks, and more, backed by comprehensive documentation efforts for user adoption and operational excellence.

projects.description:
Associated with Indian Institute of Technology, Delhi
Associated with Indian Institute of Technology, Delhi

projects.title: Havannah Game Playing AI
projects.description:
Associated with Indian Institute of Technology, Delhi
Associated with Indian Institute of Technology, Delhi
Developed an AI agent for the strategic board game Havannah, featuring intelligent decision-making using Monte Carlo Tree Search (MCTS). Supports multiple game modes (Human vs AI, AI vs Random Agent, Human vs Human), configurable board sizes (4x4 to 10x10), and time-bound moves. The project includes a GUI and command-line interface, offering an engaging and adaptable gameplay experience.
Developed an AI agent for the strategic board game Havannah, featuring intelligent decision-making using Monte Carlo Tree Search (MCTS). Supports multiple game modes (Human vs AI, AI vs Random Agent, Human vs Human), configurable board sizes (4x4 to 10x10), and time-bound moves. The project includes a GUI and command-line interface, offering an engaging and adaptable gameplay experience.
Skills: Artificial Intelligence (AI) · Monte Carlo Tree Search · Game Theory
Artificial Intelligence (AI) · Monte Carlo Tree Search · Game Theory

projects.title: Document Processing Tool and Search Engine
projects.description:
Associated with Indian Institute of Technology, Delhi
Associated with Indian Institute of Technology, Delhi
Created a search engine that will return all matching answers to an input query in
the corpus provided, similar to they way search engines return the results. For this, created a dictionary data structure for storing the word counts of the words in the document using AVL trees.
Then implement a search mechanism to search for a string in the document. Given any pattern p, returned a list of all the offsets in the document at which the pattern is present in the text.
Created a search engine that will return all matching answers to an input query in the corpus provided, similar to they way search engines return the results. For this, created a dictionary data structure for storing the word counts of the words in the document using AVL trees. Then implement a search mechanism to search for a string in the document. Given any pattern p, returned a list of all the offsets in the document at which the pattern is present in the text.
Skills: C++ · AVL trees · Search Engines · Rabin-Karp Algorithm
C++ · AVL trees · Search Engines · Rabin-Karp Algorithm

projects.title: Unlimited Int and Rationals + Expression Evaluator using Trees
projects.description:
Associated with Indian Institute of Technology, Delhi
Associated with Indian Institute of Technology, Delhi
Can make operations (+ - / * %) for numbers having any number of digits for int and rationals by making
an array consisting of digits and performing operations on them that too in just O(n^2) (n=no. of digits). Made an expression Evaluator using basic knowledge of Tree Data Structure by storing the values of
previous variables in another tree and evaluate the value of other variable by performing the operations.
Can make operations (+ - / * %) for numbers having any number of digits for int and rationals by making an array consisting of digits and performing operations on them that too in just O(n^2) (n=no. of digits). Made an expression Evaluator using basic knowledge of Tree Data Structure by storing the values of previous variables in another tree and evaluate the value of other variable by performing the operations.
Skills: Implementing Super Long Integers in C++

projects.title: Bank data class and the concept of Hashing
projects.description:
Associated with Indian Institute of Technology, Delhi
Associated with Indian Institute of Technology, Delhi
Made an efficient Hash Function which in a Bank Data class which stores the balance and updates it
also. Extracting the information of an individual in O (1) amortized time, getting top k balances. Done in 3 different Parts – Chaining, Linear Probing, Quadratic Probing, Cubic probing for efficiency.
Made an efficient Hash Function which in a Bank Data class which stores the balance and updates it also. Extracting the information of an individual in O (1) amortized time, getting top k balances. Done in 3 different Parts – Chaining, Linear Probing, Quadratic Probing, Cubic probing for efficiency.

projects.title: Monopoly Game
projects.description:
Associated with Indian Institute of Technology, Delhi
Associated with Indian Institute of Technology, Delhi
Made a two-player Monopoly game in python making strategic decisions all within a digital environment using the concepts of Object-Oriented Programming (OOPS) to model Properties and cards into classes. Used Python's built-in data structures, such as lists and dictionaries, to manage game
elements like the game board, player assets, and property information, chances and community chests.
Made a two-player Monopoly game in python making strategic decisions all within a digital environment using the concepts of Object-Oriented Programming (OOPS) to model Properties and cards into classes. Used Python's built-in data structures, such as lists and dictionaries, to manage game elements like the game board, player assets, and property information, chances and community chests.
